abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment for
            the Agricultural Export Promotion Project in Senegal, which
            assists farmers in both traditional and non-traditional crop
            production and export; supports producers to develop high
            value-added crops; and strengthens farmers organizations.
            Negative impacts on the vegetal cover, the soil, water, and
            the affected population will lead to reduced land
            productivity, water-related diseases--malaria and
            bilharzia--droughts, salinization, water contamination from
            misuse and over-use of fertilizers and pesticides, and soil
            erosion. Traffic accidents, noise due to the increased load
            of vehicles and airplanes transportation, gas emissions, and
            effluents will also occur. Mitigation includes afforestation
            efforts combined with irrigation development and an
            information campaign for soil, water, and biomass
            conservation. Hygiene education and community management and
            awareness will be developed to ensure better water supply
            and sanitation services, and to reduce disease. Preserving
            traditional floral species, setting aside protected areas,
            and introducing foreign species compatible with farm crops
            will arrest deforestation. Fuel conservation will discourage
            stripping trees. Extension services will educate farmers
            about soil conditions and composting to mitigate soil
            degradation. Installing a piezometer to control lowering
            groundwater and measuring water quality, designing
            activities to prevent floods, and regulating use will help
            manage water resources.
